article.title: Chupacabra

template.arg: An image of the Chupacabra based on its original description.

Caribbean(chiefly Puerto Rico)
Central and South America
North America(chiefly Mexico and southern United States)

article.paragraph: Thechupacabraorchupacabras(IPA-estʃupaˈkaβɾas, literally "goat-sucker") is alegendarycryptidrumored to inhabit parts of the Americas, with the first sightings reported inPuerto Rico.The name comes from the animal's reportedVampirismhabitof attacking andHematophagydrinking the bloodoflivestock, especiallygoats.
Physical descriptions of the creature vary. It is purportedly a heavy creature, the size of a small bear, with a row of spines reaching from the neck to the base of the tail.

Eyewitness sightings have been claimed as early as 1995 in Puerto Rico, and have since been reported as far north asMaine, and as far south asChile, and even being spotted outside the Americas in countries likeRussiaandThe Philippines, but many of the reports have been disregarded as uncorroborated or lacking evidence. Sightings in northern Mexico and the southern United States have been verified asCanidaecanidsafflicted bymange.cite bookRadfordBenjaminBenjamin Radford2011[[Tracking the Chupacabra|Tracking the Chupacabra: The Vampire Beast in Fact, Fiction and Folklore]]9780826350152According to biologists and wildlife management officials, the chupacabra is anurban legend.cite bookMiried Gonzalez RodriguezDizfrazado el chupacabrasPrimera HoraPuerto RicoSpanish
article.heading: Name
article.paragraph: Chupacabrascan be literally translated as "goat-sucker", fromchupar("to suck") andcabra("goat"). It is known as bothchupacabrasandchupacabrathroughout the Americas, with the former being the original word,Diccionario Clave,chupacabras. It states that both singular and plural ischupacabras.and the latter aregularization (linguistics)regularizationof it. The name in Spanish can be preceded by a singular masculine article (el chupacabras), or the plural masculine article (los chupacabras).citation neededDecember 2014
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: The first reported attacks occurred in March 1995 in Puerto Rico.cite webStephen Wagnerhttp://paranormal.about.com/library/weekly/aa051898.htmOn the trail of the ChupacabrasOctober 5, 2007In this attack, eightdomestic sheepsheepwere discovered dead, each with three puncture wounds in the chest area and completely drained of blood.A few months later, in August, an eyewitness, Madelyne Tolentino, reported seeing the creature in the Puerto Rican town ofCanvanas, Puerto RicoCanvanas, when as many as 150 farm animals and pets were reportedly killed.In 1975, similar killings in the small town ofMoca, Puerto RicoMocawere attributed toEl Vampiro de Moca(The Vampire of Moca).cite webStephen Wagnerhttp://paranormal.about.com/cs/chupacabra/a/aa071403.htmEncounters with ChupacabrasOctober 5, 2007Initially, it was suspected that the killings were committed by aSatanismSataniccult; later more killings were reported around the island, and many farms reported loss of animal life. Each of the animals was reported to have had its body bled dry through a series of small circular incisions.

Puerto Rican peoplePuerto Ricancomedian andentrepreneurSilverio Prezis credited with coining the termchupacabrassoon after the first incidents were reported in the press. Shortly after the first reported incidents in Puerto Rico, other animal deaths were reported in other countries, such as theDominican Republic,Argentina,Bolivia,Chile,Colombia,Honduras,El Salvador,Nicaragua,Panama,Peru,Brazil,United States, andMexico.
article.heading: Reputed origin
article.paragraph: A five-year investigation byBenjamin Radford, documented in his 2011 bookTracking the Chupacabra, concluded that the description given by the original eyewitness in Puerto Rico, Madelyne Tolentino, was based on the creature Sil in the science-fiction horror filmSpecies (film)Species.The alien creature Sil is nearly identical to Tolentinos chupacabra eyewitness account and she had seen the movie before her report: "It was a creature that looked like the chupacabra, with spines on its back and all... The resemblance to the chupacabra was really impressive," Tolentino reported.Corrales, Scott. Chupacabras: And Other Mysteries. ISBN 1-883729-06-8Radford revealed that Tolentino "believed that the creatures and events she saw inSpecies (film)Specieswere happening in reality in Puerto Rico at the time," and therefore concludes that "the most important chupacabra description cannot be trusted."This, Radford believes, seriously undermines the credibility of the chupacabra as a real animal.Radford, Benjamin. "Slaying the Vampire: Solving theChupacabraMystery"Skeptical Inquirer, Vol. 35 No. 3, May/June 2011, Pages 4548

In addition, the reports of blood-sucking by the chupacabra were never confirmed by anecropsy,the only way to conclude that the animal was drained of blood. An analysis by a veterinarian of 300 reported victims of the chupacabra found that they had not been bled dry.
Radford divided the chupacabra reports into two categories:

list.listitem: the reports fromPuerto RicoandLatin Americawhere animals were attacked and it is supposed their blood was extracted
the reports in theUnited Statesofmammals, mostly dogs andcoyoteswithmange, that people call "chupacabra" due to their unusual appearance

article.paragraph: In late October 2010,University of Michiganbiologist Barry O'Connor concluded that all the chupacabra reports in the United States were simply coyotes infected with the parasiteSarcoptes scabiei, whose symptoms would explain most of the features of the chupacabra: they would be left with little fur, thickened skin, and rank odour. O'Connor theorized that the attacks on goats occurred "because these animals are greatly weakened, they're going to have a hard time hunting. So they may be forced into attacking livestock because it's easier than running down a rabbit or a deer."cite webhttp://ur.umich.edu/1011/Oct25_10/1698-scary-chupacabras-monsterScary chupacabras monster is as much victim as villainumich.edu2010-10-252011-12-24

Although several witnesses came to the conclusion that the attacks could not be the work of dogs or coyotes because they had not eaten the victim, this conclusion is incorrect.Both dogs and coyotes can kill and not consume the prey, either because they are inexperienced, or due to injury or difficulty in killing the prey.cite webhttp://texnat.tamu.edu/about/procedures-for-evaluating/evaluation-of-suspected-predator-kills/Evaluation of Suspected Predator Kills2011-12-24The prey can survive the attack and die afterwards from internalbleedingorcirculatory shock.The presence of two holes in the neck, corresponding with theCanine toothcanine teeth, are to be expected since this is the only way that most landcarnivoreshave to catch their prey.

There are reports of strayMexican Hairless Dogsbeing mistaken for chupacabras.cite webhttp://edition.cnn.com/video/#/video/offbeat/2009/09/01/roldan.chupacabra.KSAT?irefBreaking News Videos, Story Video and Show Clips - CNN.com12 March 2014CNN
article.heading: Reputed sightings
article.paragraph: Numerous sightings of the creature were reported during the mid-1990s in Mexico, the U.S. Southwest and China. The first reported sightings were inPuerto Rico, US, where more than 200 original reports were made in 1995.cite webChupacabra Science: How Evolution Made a Mythical Monsterhttp://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/2010/10/101028-chupacabra-evolution-halloween-science-monsters-chupacabras-picture/National GeographicNational Geographic Society6 April 2014Ker Than28 October 2010

In July 2004, a rancher nearSan Antonio, TexasSan Antonio, Texas, killed a hairlessdog-like creature which was attacking his livestock.cite webWalker Robinsonhttp://www.woai.com/news/local/story.aspx?content_idhttp://web.archive.org/web/20051109030151/http://www.woai.com/news/local/story.aspx?content_idNovember 9, 2005Chupacabra? Strange Animal Found in ElmendorfWOAIAugust 3, 2004October 5, 2007This animal, initially given the name theElmendorf Beast, was later determined byDNAassay conducted atUniversity of California, Davisto be acoyotewith demodectic or sarcopticmange. In October 2004, two more carcasses were found in the same area.BiologyBiologistsinTexasexamined samples from the two carcasses and determined they were alsocoyotessuffering from very severe cases ofmange.cite webhttp://www.banderasnews.com/0603/art-chupacabra.htmTexas' Blood-Sucking MonsterJune 12, 2007InColeman, TexasColeman, Texas, a farmer named Reggie Lagow caught an animal in a trap he set up after the deaths of a number of hischickensandturkey (bird)turkeys. The animal was described as resembling a mix of hairless dog,rat, andkangaroo. Lagow provided the animal to Texas Parks and Wildlife officials for identification, but Lagow reported in a September 17, 2006, phone interview with John Adolfi, founder of the Lost World Museum, that the "critter was caught on a Tuesday and thrown out in Thursday's trash."cite newshttp://www.nbc4.tv/news/4895053/detail.htmlTexas Farmer Claims He Caught Legendary 'Chupacabra'KNBC Los AngelesAugust 25, 2005https://web.archive.org/web/20051026021126/http://www.nbc4.tv/news/4895053/detail.html2005-10-26

In April 2006,MosNewsreported that the chupacabra was spotted in Russia for the first time. Reports fromCentral Federal DistrictCentral Russiabeginning in March 2005 tell of a beast that kills animals and sucks out their blood. 32 turkeys were killed and drained overnight. Reports later came from neighboring villages when 30 sheep were killed and had their blood drained. Finally, eyewitnesses were able to describe the chupacabra. In May 2006, experts were determined to track the animal down.cite newshttp://www.mosnews.com/news/2006/04/27/chupacabra.shtmlChupacabra the Goatsucker Vampire Sightings Reported in Central RussiaMosNewsApril 17, 2006Dead linkSeptember 2010According to Russian paranormal researcherVadim Chernobrov, the territory allegedly frequented by chupacabras lies in theKharkovregion ofUkraineand neighboring regions of Russia, but also in parts of Belarus and Poland. Recently the reports appeared of chupacabra-like attacks in the Moscow region of Russia with dozens of birds and animals found bloodless, with strange incisions. At least twice the mysterious kangaroo-like creature ("with a crocodile head") attacked humans, causing no serious damage, though. According to Chernobrov, the two extraordinary things about the chupacabras' ways are that the thing leaves a 'vanishing' line of footprints, looking as if it takes off as a bird, and also it tends occasionally to assort its victim's bodies 'aesthetically', often by colour and size, or build pyramids with killed bodies.cite webhttp://planeta.moy.su/blog/govorim_i_pokazyvaem_chto_za_monstr_02_11_2012/2012-11-04-34142What’s This Beast?NTV Russia. Talk and Show2012-03-01

In mid-August 2006, Michelle O'Donnell ofTurner, MaineTurner, Maine, described an "evil looking" rodent-like animal with fangs that had been found dead alongside a road. The animal was apparently struck by a car, and was unidentifiable. Photographs were taken and witness reports seem to be in relative agreement that the creature was canine in appearance, but in widely published photos seemed unlike any dog orGray Wolfwolfin the area. Photos from other angles seem to show aChow Chowchoworakita (dog)akitamixed-breed dog. It was reported that "the carcass was picked clean byvulturesbefore experts could examine it". For years, residents ofMainehave reported a mysterious creature and a string of dog maulings.cite newshttp://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/M/MYSTERY_BEAST?SITE'Hybrid Mutant' Found Dead in MaineAssociated PressAugust 16, 2006Dead linkMarch 2009

In May 2007, a series of reports on nationalColombianews reported more than 300 dead sheep in the region ofDepartment of BoyacBoyaca, and the capture of a possible specimen to be analyzed byzoologyzoologistsat theNational University of Colombia.cite newshttp://www.eltiempo.com/nacion/boyaca/ARTICULO-WEB-NOTA_INTERIOR-3539469.html''Bestia' chupasangre asusta a los campesinos de Chiscas: ha matado 310 animales'El TiempoMay 2, 2007yeshttps://web.archive.org/20150316162707/http://www.eltiempo.com/nacion/boyaca/ARTICULO-WEB-NOTA_INTERIOR-3539469.html16 March 2015

In August 2007,Cuero, Texas#Sighting of Chupacabra in 2007 and 2008Phylis Canionfound three animals inCuero, TexasCuero, Texas. She and her neighbors reported to have discovered three strange animal carcasses outside Canion's property. She took photographs of the carcasses and preserved the head of one in her freezer before turning it over for DNA analysis.cite newshttp://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20070831/ap_on_re_us/mythical_chupacabra_1;_yltHas a mythical beast turned up in Texas?August 31, 2007yeshttps://web.archive.org/20150402143446/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20070831/ap_on_re_us/mythical_chupacabra_1;_ylt2 April 2015Canion reported that nearly 30 chickens on her farm had beenExsanguinationexsanguinatedover a period of years, a factor which led her to connect the carcasses with the chupacabra legend. StateMammalogyMammologistJohn Young estimated that the animal in Canion's pictures was aGray Foxsuffering from an extreme case ofmange. In November 2007, biology researchers atTexas State UniversitySan Marcosdetermined from DNA samples that the suspicious animal was a coyote.cite newshttp://www.txstate.edu/news/news_releases/news_archive/2007/11/Chupacabra110107.htmlTexas State researchers solve mystery of Cuero chupacabraTexas State University News ServiceNovember 1, 2007The coyote, however, had grayish-blue, mostly hairless skin and large fanged teeth, attributes which caused it to appear different from a normal coyote.cite newshttp://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,307576,00.htmlTexas Woman Claims to Have Found Mythical 'Chupacabra'Foxnews.comAssociated PressFebruary 27, 2009November 2, 2007Additional skin samples were taken to attempt to determine the cause of the hair loss.

On January 11, 2008, a sighting was reported at the province ofCapizin thePhilippines. Some of the residents from thebarangaybelieved that it was the chupacabra that killed eight chickens. The owner of the chickens saw a dog-like animal attacking his chickens.cite newshttp://newsinfo.inquirer.net/inquirerheadlines/regions/view_article.php?article_id'Blood Suckerkilling farm animals in Capiz'InquirerJanuary 11, 2008https://web.archive.org/web/20080117221049/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/inquirerheadlines/regions/view_article.php?article_id2008-01-17

On August 8, 2008, aDeWitt County, TexasDeWitt Countydeputy, Brandon Riedel, filmed an unidentifiable animal along back roads nearCuero, TexasCuero, Texas, on his dashboard camera.cite newshttp://www.foxnews.com/video/index.html?referralObjectLegend Lives On'FOXNewsAugust 12, 2008yeshttps://web.archive.org/20150413123552/http://www.foxnews.com/video/index.html?referralObject13 April 2015The animal was about the size of a coyote but was hairless with a long snout, short front legs and long back legs. However, Reiter's boss, Sheriff Jode Zavesky, believes it may be the same species of coyote identified byTexas State UniversitySan Marcosresearchers in November 2007.cite newshttp://www.cnn.com/video/#/video/us/2008/08/12/pkg.tx.chupucabra.kens'Is this Texas' goat-sucker'CNNAugust 11, 2008The video footage was shown on an April 2011 episode of theSyfytelevision seriesFact or Faked: Paranormal Fileswhere an investigative team tried to recreate the dashboard video footage using aminiature horseand aMexican Hairless Dog(both of which were bred locally). Neither test animal matched the creature in the video. The team had also tested a DNA sample taken from an alleged carcass of one of the creatures found by a local rancher and later identified as being a hybrid wolf/coyote.

In September 2009,CNNaired a report showing closeup video footage of an unidentified dead animal. The same CNN report stated that locals have begun speculating the possibility that this might be a chupacabra. ABlanco, TexasBlanco,Texas, taxidermist reported that he received the body from a former student whose cousin had discovered the animal in his barn, where it had succumbed to poison left out for rodents. The taxidermist expressed his belief that this is a genetically mutated coyote.CNN video report, September 3, 2009.Texas mystery: 'Defective coyote' or chupacabra?, CNN, September 4, 2009.

On September 18, 2009, taxidermist Jerry Ayer sold the Blanco Texas Chupacabra to the Lost World Museum. The museum, as reported in the Syracuse Post Standard on September 26, 2009, is placing the creature on display as it works with an unnamed university to have the remains tested.

In July 2010, there were reports of chupacabras being shot dead by animal control officers inHood County,Texas. A second creature was also reportedly spotted and killed several miles away.cite webhttp://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/21134540/vp/38224385#38224385msnbc.com Video PlayerMSNBC2010-09-06cite webhttp://blastr.com/2010/07/chupacabra-found-officer.phpChupacabra found? Officer kills it, claims: 'It wasn't normal'Blastr2010-07-132010-09-06Dead linkSeptember 2010cite newshttp://www.foxnews.com/scitech/2010/07/14/was-el-chupacabra-spied-texas/Fox NewsWas El Chupacabra Spied in Texas?July 15, 2010However, an officer of Hood County animal control saidTexas A&M Universityscientists conducted tests and identified the corpse as a "Coydogcoyote-dog hybrid" with signs ofmangeand internalparasites. The second reported chupacabra, shot July 9 about 8 miles south ofCresson, TexasCresson, was eaten byvulturesbefore it could be taken for testing.cite webhttp://www.upi.com/Odd_News/2010/07/14/Expert-Chupacabra-a-coyote-dog-hybrid/UPI-80031279145698/Expert: 'Chupacabra' a coyote-dog hybridUPI.com2010-07-142010-09-06

On December 18, 2010, inNelson County, Kentucky, Mark Cothren shot and killed an animal that he could not recognize and feared.cite webhttp://www.wave3.com/story/13731615/mysterious-creature-found-in-nelson-countyMysterious creature found in Nelson CountyWave3.com2010-12-232011-10-31Many pictures of the Chupacabra were taken and the story was well documented by various news organizations. Cothren described the creature as having large ears, whiskers, a long tail, and about the size of a house cat. Cothren says he spoke with theKentucky Department of Fish and Wildlife Resourcesand handed over the preserved animal for further analysis.cite webhttp://www.foxnews.com/scitech/2010/12/28/man-shoots-kills-chupacabra-kentucky/Man Shoots, Kills 'Chupacabra' in KyDecember 28, 2010February 4, 2014Fox News

On July 4, 2011, Jack (Jeff) Crabtree, of Lake Jackson, Texas, reported seeing a chupacabra in his back yard. At first, Crabtree stood firm on his original theory of the chupacabra, but after the local newspaper and several other media reporters wrote his story on July 11, he quickly backed down, agreeing with wildlife experts that it was most likely acoyotewith mange. "It was a spoof or a practical joke," Crabtree said. "...I really didn't believe it." His story appeared onCNN, as well asMSNBC.cite webhttp://news.blogs.cnn.com/2011/07/12/gotta-watch-mythical-creatures/Gotta Watch: Mythical creatures – This Just InNews.blogs.cnn.com2011-10-31cite webhttp://thefacts.com/news/article_ad86217c-ab69-11e0-88a5-001cc4c002e0.htmlChupacabra reportedly spotted in Lake JacksonThe Facts2011-10-31cite webhttp://thefacts.com/news/article_7022944e-ac38-11e0-b68b-001cc4c03286.htmlBelieve in chupacabra? LJ man now changes his storyThe Facts2011-10-31cite webhttp://www.click2houston.com/news/28514536/detail.htmlChupacabra Roaming In Lake Jackson? – Houston News Story — KPRC HoustonClick2houston.com2011-07-112011-10-31yeshttps://web.archive.org/20110911082733/http://www.click2houston.com:80/news/28514536/detail.html11 September 2011cite webhttp://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/43720331/ns/technology_and_science-science/'Chupacabra' rears its ugly head in TexasMSNBC2011-10-31cite webhttp://abclocal.go.com/ktrk/story?sectionPhotos of peculiar animal near Lake Jackson spark rumors of mythical chupacabra | abc13.comAbclocal.go.com2011-07-112011-10-31On July 15, 2011, local authorities caught what Crabtree saw. Experts confirmed that the animal was definitely a coyote with mange.cite webhttp://thefacts.com/news/article_22105550-af50-11e0-b332-001cc4c002e0.htmlUpdates for July 16, 2011The Facts2011-07-162011-10-31

On September 17, 2013, the Fox 2 News affiliate in Saint Louis, Missouri, posted on its website a report of two sightings. In the first, a woman spotted a "small grey dog-like animal" near the front gate of the Old Lake Hill Speedway in Saint Louis. A week previously, a hunter claimed to have killed a chupacabra while "coon hunting". The Mississippi Department of Wildlife said that it was a dog with mange.cite newshttp://fox2now.com/2013/09/17/chupacabra-spotted-in-valley-park/Woman claims to have spotted a "Chupacabra" in St. Louisfox2now.com4 October 2013

In October 2013, WOWT News in Omaha reported that two Nebraska Department of Roads employees claimed to have spotted a chupacabra just outside ofBlair, Nebraska. The individuals took photos of the animal that they described as a four-legged Dracula and a scrawny, scraggly thing. The animal had no hair and looked skinny and weak. Later, the Director of Animal Health at the Henry Doorly Zoo in Omaha, Nebraska, identified the animal as a coyote.cite newshttp://www.wowt.com/home/headlines/Photos-Capture-Mythical-Beast-227663151.htmlNebraska Department of Roads employees claim to have spotted a "Chupacabra" in Blair, Nebraskawowt.com12 December 2014

A Texan couple who reside on a ranch inVictoria County, TexasVictoria County, Texas informed the media that they had shot and killed a chupacabra on their property during the evening of February 23, 2014. A wildlife biologist with the Texas Parks and Wildlife organization also spoke with the media and stated: "I've seen squirrels, raccoons and coyotes in this area with the same features. They're [chupacabra] a mythical creature that most people see, but what it really is sarcoptic mange which is caused by a mite that bites the animal and it can be on any mammal - dogs, cats, coyotes foxes, and humans can get another version of it as well."cite newsTexan family claim to have 'killed a mythical chupacabra'http://www.independent.co.uk/news/texan-family-kill-a-mythical-chupacabra-9156618.html6 April 2014The Independent27 February 2014Heather Saul

On April 3, 2014, a Texan couple claimed to have captured a chupacabra inRatcliffe, Texason March 29, 2014cite newshttp://guardianlv.com/2014/04/texas-couple-claims-they-have-caught-a-chupacabra/Texas Couple Claims They Have Caught A ChupacabraLiberty Voice3 April 2014Livescience's Benjamin Radford suggested the animal is a raccoon suffering from sarcoptic mange.cite webTexas 'Chupacabra' Turns Out to Be Imposterhttp://www.livescience.com/44617-texas-chupacabra-mystery.htmlLive Science JournalTechMedia Network6 April 2014Benjamin Radford4 April 2014
article.heading: Appearance
article.paragraph: The most common description of the chupacabra is that of areptile-like creature, said to have leathery or scaly greenish-gray skin and sharp spines or quills running down its back.cite webhttp://skepdic.com/chupa.htmlChupacabras BiographyMay 10, 2007It is said to be approximately 3 to 4 feet (1 to 1.2 m) high, and stands and hops in a fashion similar to that of akangaroo.cite webStephen Wagnerhttp://paranormal.about.com/library/weekly/aa010101b.htmThe Top 10 Most Mysterious Creatures of Modern TimesOctober 5, 2007

Another less common description of the chupacabra is of a strange breed of wild dog.This form is mostly hairless and has a pronounced spinal ridge, unusually pronounced eye sockets, fangs, and claws. Unlike conventional predators, the chupacabra is said to drain all of the animal's blood (and sometimes organs) usually through three holes in the shape of an upside-down triangle or through one or two holes.cite webTomás De Jesús Mangualhttp://www.vocero.com/noticias.asp?shttp://web.archive.org/web/20071011110443/http://vocero.com/noticias.asp?s2007-10-11Imputan otro ataque al ChupacabrasEl VoceroJanuary 9, 2006October 5, 2007
article.heading: Related legends
article.paragraph: A popular legend inNew Orleansconcerns a popular lovers' lane called Grunch Road, which was said to be inhabited by "grunches", creatures similar in appearance to theChupacabra.

ThePeuchenofChilealso share similarities in their supposed habits, but instead of being dog-like they are described as winged snakes. This legend may have originated from thevampire bat, an animal endemic to the region.Article: Tras los pasos del chupacabras. El centro, Journal. 26-07-2004es iconDead linkOctober 2011

In thePhilippines, anotherlegendary creaturecalled theSigbinshares many of the same descriptions as theChupacabra. The recent discovery of thecat-foxin Southeast Asia suggests that it could also have been simply sightings of this once unknown animal.cite newsMeekJamesOn the trail of the Borneo cat-foxThe Guardian2005-12-07http://www.guardian.co.uk/conservation/story/0,13369,1660581,00.html2007-07-23
article.heading: In popular culture

preblock.preline: The popularity of the chupacabra has resulted in its being featured in several types of media.

list.listitem: At least one published mystery novel uses aspects of the myth as the centerpoint of the plot.Wagner, Lloyd.El Chupacabras: Trail of the Goatsucker.ISBN 0-595-33315-XOther kinds of books include those that provide a scientific explanation for the phenomena.Corrales, Scott.Chupacabras: And Other Mysteries.ISBN 1-883729-06-8Authors, Mandy, and Clifton C. Phillips.Chupacabra, You Don't Scare Me!ISBN 0-8059-4490-7
The chupacabra has appeared in various science fiction andmonster movies, includingChupacabra: Dark Seas, starringJohn Rhys-Davies, andGuns of El Chupacabra, starringScott Shaw.

CNN's Ed Lavandera has described the chupacabra as the "BigfootofLatin American cultureLatino culture" and has stated that "El Chupacabra also symbolizes the fear of something that doesn't exist".cite newshttp://edition.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0605/02/lt.01.htmlIllegal Immigrants Frightened by Raid Rumors; George Bush: "The Decider"; "Happy Slapping"CNNMay 2, 2006October 5, 2007Following the incident inCuero, TexasCuero, Texas, the popularity of the chupacabra myth was receiving global attention.cite webhttp://www.kvue.com/news/top/stories/082807kvuechupacabracraze-cb.7c603ee0.htmlChupacabra craze goes globalKVUEAugust 28, 2007October 5, 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071204230222/http://www.kvue.com/news/top/stories/082807kvuechupacabracraze-cb.7c603ee0.htmlDecember 4, 2007Phylis Canion, who was responsible for capturing the alleged specimen, claimed that T-shirts highlighting the event were shipped to locations such as Italy,Guam, andIraq. The publicity that Cuero received following this event has led to some suggesting changing the town's mascot.In July 2008,History (U.S. TV channel)History'sMonster Questseries featured the Texas carcasses, which were determined to be dogs and coyotes.cite webhttp://www.history.com/minisites/monsterquestMonsterQuest: ChupacabraJuly 23, 2008July 24, 2008
The Welsh rock bandSuper Furry Animalshas a song on the 1997 albumRadiatorcalled "Chupacabras".''Chupacabras''(lyrics). Super Furry Animals.Radiator(album). 1997

In a special issue ofMarvel Comics'Fantastic Fourreleased on December 28, 2007, a group of chupacabras are featured as antagonists.cite webChupacabras Marvel backBealeLewishttp://www.nydailynews.com/latino/chupacabras-marvel-back-article-1.277378NY Daily News26 December 20072013-06-22

In episode 45 of the second season ofDexter's Laboratory, Dexter, boy genius, creates 'La Chupacabra' by mistake, a creature who devours everything, and makes its way to South America. Dexter and DeeDee go there to find and stop it.cite webhttp://www.tv.com/shows/dexters-laboratory/got-your-goat-24584/Dexters Lab: Got Your GoatFebruary 23, 2014

The myth of the chupacabra is mocked in the 2012 episode "Jewpacabra" of the cartoon seriesSouth Parkin which antisemitic main character Eric Cartman claims to have seen a Jewish Chupacabra that kills children on Easter.citation neededDecember 2014
A chupacabra is featured in theThe Grim Adventures of Billy & MandySeason 4 episode "Aren't You Chupacabra to See Me?"
A hunt for the chupacraba is at the center of the plot of the "Isla de las Chupacabras" episode ofAdult Swim'sSealab 2021.
Chupacabras are dismissed by Dr. Venture as mythical inThe Venture Brothersepisode "Dia de Los Dangerous!" (Season 1, Number 1), before a number of them appear in Brock Sampson's car.

article.heading: References
